organization.fullName: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

identificationModule.briefTitle: CHARGE Study: CHoice ARchitecture Genetic tEsting
identificationModule.officialTitle: CHARGE: CHOICE ARCHITECTURE IN GENETIC TESTING

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

leadSponsor.name: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: CHARGE is a hybrid type I feasibility study to compare a choice architecture intervention for cascade genetic testing to usual care.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: CHARGE study contains two arms: Arm 1) Usual care, comprising of standard genetic counseling and education to probands regarding cascade testing; and Arm 2) Direct mailing of a home genetic testing kit to probands' at-risk relatives that can be returned directly to a commercial genetic testing laboratory, including educational information on the importance and cost of cascade testing

armGroups.label: Standard of care cascade testing
armGroups.description: Standard of care cascade genetic testing

armGroups.label: Choice architecture cascade testing
armGroups.description: Direct mailed genetic testing kit to probands' relatives.

interventions.name: Enhanced cascade testing
interventions.description: Direct mailed at-home genetic testing kit to probands' relatives.

primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of at-risk relatives who undergo testing

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in probands' family communication about genetic test results as measured by Proband survey
secondaryOutcomes.description: Frequency and content of family communication will be measured by Proband survey (result sharing, reasons for sharing and not sharing)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proband's and relative's satisfaction with decision about participating in study measured at approximately 4- 7 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Probands' and relative's satisfaction with decision about participating in study will be measured at approximately 4- 7 months using surveys (intervention arm). This is measured using the satisfaction with decision scale.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Family functioning as reported by probands and relatives measured by Cancer Family Impact Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Relatives' and probands' family functioning will be measured by a survey that includes the adapted Cancer Family Impact Scale. Participants responses to the 18 items of CFIS on a 5-point Likert scale are summed for scoring. Higher summed scores indicated a greater communication and flow of about cancer information within family and therefore better family functioning.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proband's reaction to intervention materials as measured by proband survey.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proband survey will include adapted versions of usability questions, commonly used in usability tests of eHealth tools that assess satisfaction, liking, ease of use, and preference. Possible scores range from 0-5 where lower score indicates better outcome.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Proband Inclusion Criteria:

* Have a newly reported pathogenic or likely pathogenic variant in one or more of the following genes: APC, ATM, BRCA1, BRCA2, CDH1, CHEK2, PALB2, MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, PMS2, PTEN, TP53
* 18 years of age or older
* English fluency
* Have at least 1 adult living genetically related relative who resides in Texas

Proband Exclusion Criteria:

* Referred for genetic testing by a relative with a pathogenic variant
* Unwilling to be randomized to a study arm

Relative Inclusion Criteria:

* 18 years of age or older
* English fluency
* Residing in Texas
